did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection contains three letters to W. S. Harris, two by John Puller (July and August 1863) and one by D. C. Cahill(?) (April 1863).

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Letters to W. S. Harris must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Letters to W. S. Harris, Ms2013-065, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Letters to W. S. Harris was acquired by Special Collections prior to 2006.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Letters to W. S. Harris was completed in September 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains three letters to W. S. Harris, two by John Puller (July and August 1863) and one by D. C. Cahill(?) (April 1863). Puller's letters, written from Petersburg, Virginia, discuss a series of business transactions (the buying and selling of farm animals and equipment) between Puller and Harris. The letter from Cahill, written at Camp Narrows, talks about Harris helping to send or bring Cahill new pants and a new coat.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in chronological order.
